Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hylin-Pul4 (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: skin, the tree frog,Boana pulchella, South America

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (78.95%) tohylin-Pul3A=I=G=21%, L=16%, K=R=5%. GRAVY: 1.25; mol wt: 1939.335: Mol formula:  C96H143N23O20; Mol ex Coeff: 0.Activity: active against E. coli (MIC 52 uM) and S. aureus (MIC 26 uM).Structure:  random coil in water and helical in lipid vesicles, especially anionic DMPG.
Literature Information.Author: Aguilar S, Brunetti AE, Garay AV, Santos LC, Perez LO, Moreira D, Cancelarich L, Barbosa EA, Basso NG, de Freitas SM, Faivovich J, Brand G, Cabrera GM, Leite JRSA, Marani MM. 2022
Literature Information.Title: Structure and function of cationic hylin bioactive peptides from the tree frog Boana pulchella in interaction with lipid membranes.
